books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Guy de Maupassant
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Guy de Maupassant, in order of date of composition.

books.title: Maiwa’s Revenge
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: A famed hunter aids a tribe in their plot for revenge.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Pollyanna
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: An orphan’s unrelenting optimism sees her through adversity and lifts up her new community.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: Troilus and Cressida
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A Trojan prince falls in love with a woman amid the Trojan War, only to see her exchanged to the Greeks for a prisoner of war.

books.title: The Warlord of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: John Carter, an Earth-man transported to Mars, must rescue his beloved princess from imprisonment in the Martian Temple of the Sun.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A London lawyer investigates the relationship between a brilliant scientist and a misshapen misanthrope.

books.title: My Disillusionment in Russia
books.author: Emma Goldman
books.summary: Emma Goldman recounts her experiences living in the early Soviet Union.

books.title: The Bellamy Trial
books.author: Frances Noyes Hart
books.summary: A man and a woman are on trial for the murder of his wife, her friend.

books.title: The Book of Tea
books.author: Okakura Kakuzō
books.summary: The Book of Tea is a long essay exploring the relationship between teaism, taoism, and the aesthetics of Japanese culture.

books.title: The Public and Its Problems
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A discussion of the political philosophy of a democratic society.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper
books.summary: A collection of poems by Frances Ellen Watkins Harper.

books.title: Democracy
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A wealthy New York widow moves to Washington, DC, hoping to get “to the heart of the great American mystery of democracy and government.”

books.title: The War of the Worlds
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: The first-person narrative of the Martian invasion of 19th-century Earth.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.summary: A collection of Anthony Trollope’s short stories, ordered by date of first publication.

books.title: A Confession
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A brief meditation on depression, philosophy, religion, and the meaning of life.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
